content.description: The obvious jug line on the roof. Start on the jugs at the bottom and work your way from monster jug to monster jug. Top out is crux. Either pull hard up to the horn or move out to the left to pull over the top.
content.protection: Pads. Good to have spotters for top out
content.location: The right most of the three really classic lines on this roof

content.description: Begin with a sit start, throw left hand to obvious fat sloppy pinch, stick the match and climb out the roof
content.protection: Crash pads and spotters for topout
content.location: First problem to the right of The Standard

content.description: Follow long moves on small holds out the roof
content.location: First boulder problem to the left of Devil on a Leash

content.description: Distinct & awkward lowball on the short boulder next to the Gill wall. Hands follow the lip from left to right on good slopers.
content.location: Begin on good holds in the middle of the small boulder to the left of the Gill Roof

content.description: Start in corner on left of Leashless Angel. Go right and traverse around roof till you are past the corner then topout. Save some strength, top out is probably the crux.
content.protection: Crash pads and spotter for top out
content.location: Sit start on low ledge left of Leashless Angel

content.description: Sit start right facing crack to the right of Pinch Me. Move out to the obvious shelf then traverse left. Same top out at Pinch Me.
content.protection: Crash pads and spotters for topout
content.location: Begins at the crack to the right of Pinch Me

content.description: Start with a huge move to small holds, continue out through jug eventually to right hand side pull, stick the swing at the end and top out.
content.location: This is the boulder line that goes out the middle of the Gill Roof.

content.description: Awesome Sandstone roof loaded with boulder problems with lower end difficulty trad lines nearby. A frequented site by locals.
